pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.7: “I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who is an expert on the Monastic Law.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.8: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.9: “How could Venerable Channa say this when legitimately corrected by the monks?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.11: “Is it true, Channa, that you said this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.15: “Foolish man, how could you say this when legitimately corrected by the monks?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.18: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.19.1: ‘If a monk, when legitimately corrected by the monks, says, “I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who is an expert on the Monastic Law,” he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:1.20: A monk who is training should understand, should question, should enquire. This is the proper procedure.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.1.8: the training rules laid down by the Buddha—this is called “legitimately”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.1.9: When corrected in regard to this, he says, “I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who’s an expert on the Monastic Law.” If he says, “I’ll question one who’s wise,” “I’ll question one who’s competent,” “I’ll question one who’s intelligent,” “I’ll question one who’s learned,” “I’ll question an expounder of the Teaching,” he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.1: If the one who corrects him is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he says such a thing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.2: If the one who corrects him is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he says such a thing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.3: If the one who corrects him is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he says such a thing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.4: If he is corrected about something that has not been laid down:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.5: “This isn’t conducive to self-effacement,” “This isn’t conducive to ascetic practices,” “This isn’t conducive to being inspiring,” “This isn’t conducive to a reduction in things,” “This isn’t conducive to being energetic,” and he says, “I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who’s competent,” “… until I’ve questioned a monk who’s an expert on the Monastic Law,” “… until I’ve questioned a monk who’s wise,” “… until I’ve questioned a monk who’s intelligent,” “… until I’ve questioned a monk who’s learned,” “… until I’ve questioned a monk who’s an expounder of the Teaching,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.6: If he is corrected by one who is not fully ordained about something that has or has not been laid down:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.7: “This isn’t conducive to self-effacement,” “This isn’t conducive to ascetic practices,” “This isn’t conducive to being inspiring,” “This isn’t conducive to a reduction in things,” “This isn’t conducive to being energetic,” and he says, “I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who’s competent,” “… until I’ve questioned a monk who’s an expert on the Monastic Law,” “… until I’ve questioned a monk who’s wise,” “… until I’ve questioned a monk who’s intelligent,” “… until I’ve questioned a monk who’s learned,” “… until I’ve questioned a monk who’s an expounder of the Teaching,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.8: If the one who corrects him is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.9: If the one who corrects him is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.10: If the one who corrects him is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.2.16: should ask, “Venerable, how is this? What’s the meaning of this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.3.2: if he says, “I’ll find out and I’ll train;”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.3.4: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc71:2.3.5: The training rule on legitimately, the first, is finished.
